comments.text: We should consider switching to layout.spellcheckInline for our spell check pref. This would mean that spell check in the compose window and spell check in content tabs/conversation view are hooked up to the same preference in the preferences window. I think that makes sense.
comments.author: rain@sunshowers.io
comments.raw_text: We should consider switching to layout.spellcheckInline for our spell check pref. This would mean that spell check in the compose window and spell check in content tabs/conversation view are hooked up to the same preference in the preferences window. I think that makes sense.

So if layout.spellCheckInline is false and a textarea has spellcheck="true", what happens? People complain that in Thunderbird Conversations, there's no way to disable the spell check feature in the quick reply, and I wonder if that would help...
